title: Macron’s Plan on Migrants: Deport More, Give Others Legal Status
description: Under pressure from the right, the government of President Emmanuel Macron tries to balance a perceived immigration problem with a need for migrant workers.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing: Trump Organization Convicted in Tax Fraud Scheme
description: Plus the funeral of China’s former leader and Indonesia bans extramarital sex.

title: Renewables Will Overtake Coal by Early 2025, Energy Agency Says
description: In a new report, the international group said that solar, wind and other renewable sources will expand much more swiftly than forecast last year.

title: Don Luce, Activist Who Helped End the Vietnam War, Dies at 88
description: His relentless campaign against the war and his exposure of South Vietnam’s “tiger cages” were instrumental in turning the American public and Congress against the war.

title: Latvia revokes the license of TV Rain, a major independent Russian channel.
What to Know About Strep A Infections Among Children in the UK
description: Several children have died from strep A this season, health officials said on Tuesday. Here is a quick list of symptoms and other important information.

title: Curse Words Around the World Have Something in Common (We Swear)
description: These four sounds are missing from some of the seven words you can never say on television, and the pattern prevails in other languages too, researchers say.

title: For Sunak, Like Biden, Dullness Could Be a Secret Weapon
description: For all their differences, President Biden and Prime Minister Rishi Sunak of Britain share a challenge: operating in the wake of a larger-than-life predecessor. They have tactics in common, too.

title: Netanyahu Coalition Roils Israel Before Government Is Formed
description: Efforts by Benjamin Netanyahu to appease his extremist coalition partners have been met with a backlash from Israeli liberals.

title: Xi Jinping of China to Visit Saudi Arabia for Regional Summits
description: Xi Jinping is expected to sign a flurry of contracts with the Saudis and other Gulf States, highlighting Beijing’s growing clout in the region when Washington has pulled away.

title: A Clash of Rights
description: The Supreme Court will decide a case over gay rights and free speech.

title: Drone Hits Russian Oil Depot Day After Ukraine Strikes Deep Inside Russia
description: Ukraine used drones to target two military bases hundreds of miles inside Russia on Monday, demonstrating Kyiv’s ability to strike such long distances.

title: China’s Leader Emphasizes Unity at Jiang Zemin’s Funeral
description: Paying tribute to President Jiang Zemin, China’s leader, Xi Jinping, urged the nation to rally around himself, a week after protests tested his authority.

title: Argentina’s Most Powerful Politician Faces a Verdict in Corruption Trial
description: If found guilty, the country’s vice-president, Cristina Fernández de Kirchner, could face 12 years in prison for steering public works contracts to a family friend.

title: Global Car Supply Chains Entangled With Abuses in Xinjiang, Report Says
description: A new report on the auto industry cites extensive links to Xinjiang, where the U.S. government now presumes goods are made with forced labor.

title: Putin signs a law banning expressions of L.G.B.T.Q. identity in Russia.
Russia continues to manufacture cruise missiles despite Western sanctions, experts say.
description: Weapons investigators in Kyiv found that at least one Russian Kh-101 cruise missile used in widespread attacks there on Nov. 23 had been made no earlier than October.

title: In Sweeping New Law, Indonesia Outlaws Sex Outside of Marriage
description: An earlier version of the bill was shelved in 2019 after tens of thousands of young people protested in the streets, arguing that the law threatened their civil liberties.

title: A Russian Journalist’s Reference to Russian Troops Causes Fury and Soul Searching.
description: An unscripted comment by a television host has plunged a major independent Russian media outlet in crisis, and put focus on the public role of Russian exiles in their country’s war.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Ukraine strikes military bases deep in Russia.

title: Ukraine Drones Target Military Bases Deep in Russia, Showing Expanded Reach
description: Launching drones at air bases 300 miles from its own territory, Ukraine changed the geography of the war. It said it had developed drones with a range of over 600 miles.
